title: Superland
content:
Although this isnt a Keen game, it is very much inspired by the Keen games. The main player sprite is even 16x24 pixels. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] I am making an opensource game called 'Superland' in C++. It features a Keen-like gameplay, with small levels, jumping, shooting and collecting points. Eventually i would like to make some connection to the Keen-games, like introducing the Standard Gallactic Alphabet, or the Dopefish or something. I might even use Billy Blaze somewhere in the story.

It is not finished yet, but here is a small gameplay teaser movie:
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=bmJ_lXNPvx8]youtube.com/watch?v=bmJ_lXNPvx8[/url]

The quality sucks, because Youtube compressed it very much. I will post some screenshots here soon, so you can see what the graphics look like.


I could use some help from level editors, sprite creators and tile creators. If someone is interested, post it here. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

I put this topic in 'Unofficial Keen games' because it is a Keen-inspired game. If this does not belong in 'Unofficial Keen games' someone may move it to another subforum. [img]http://members1.chello.nl/~j.demeij/keenav.gif[/img] [url=http://www.64kpixels.net]www.64kpixels.net[/url]

title: Re: Superland
content:
Judging by the trailer it looks pretty solid already! Good graphics. I'll surely try it out when it's done.

(But I'll have to move this topic, I think. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] )3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: keen
content:
You are right that i am including a little bit of Mario-style. It's not gonna be a Keen clone, i want to make a mix of Keen gameplay, Jill of the Jungle gameplay, Mario gameplay and.. maybe Jazz Jackrabbit. Even some Charlie the Duck (if anyone knows that game) Basically all the games i love.

But ofcoarse i love Keen the most, so it will be Keen-style for the most part! I agree the last level looks very Mario-esque, but that was a testing level. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-helmet.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: f
content:
>> What kind of level editing utility would be used for this game? I'm sort of interested in possibly making levels for it...

The level editing sucks pretty much now, i don't really know how to make a level editor, so i am using bitmaps for levels. Every pixel has a color that represents a tile. Maybe sometimes i can code a level editor that is WYSIWYG.

Thanks for the nice replies here [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://members1.chello.nl/~j.demeij/keenav.gif[/img] [url=http://www.64kpixels.net]www.64kpixels.net[/url]

title: Re: f
content:
That sounds like it'd be pretty awkward for level editing, but maybe I could give it a go if you send me a beta/alpha/whatsitsface of the game.

I'd be interested in working on levels, this game looks like it has some potential.------------------

I tried that once too, and it isn't actually THAT bad of a method. Good alternative between making a level editor and making the game customizable, and you could always base a level editor off the pixels in a bitmap (or png!) anyway.____________

title: Re: g
content:
Wow, impressive work so far. I presume since you're using SDL that it'll be cross-platform? It'd be nice to see some more games of this quality for the non-Windows world.

[hr]Dreams The level editing sucks pretty much now, i don't really know how to make a level editor, so i am using bitmaps for levels.
[hr]I've always found level editors to be the easy part. The hard stuff for me is managing the sprites and AI, which I'm only just starting to get my head around now.

title: Re: g
content:
I am using SDL, so it could be ported to other OS'es in the future. I do use some Win32 calls, but they can be converted to SDL too. That's just a bit lazy programming from me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

Level editing isn't difficult, but it is not WYSIWIG, so you must know what you are doing, and you have to picture what the level looks like in your head.

For people who think it does not look Keen-ish:[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]
